summary: This bill, the Banning Strategic Petroleum Reserve Oil Exports to Foreign Adversaries Act, prohibits the Secretary of Energy from exporting or selling petroleum products drawn from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve to specific countries (China, North Korea, Russia, Iran) or entities under their control. The Secretary can waive the prohibition if it's in the national security interest, and must issue a rule to implement the changes within 60 days. The bill also makes conforming amendments to other sections of the Energy Policy and Conservation Act.
